bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Documents belonging to Dr. Aristides Agramonte, by Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, [August 6, 1950]

div1.p: Rodriguez Leon lists papers that belonged to her father, Aristides Agramonte, that are on loan to Hench. She would like Hench to return them.

div1.head: Documents belonging to Dr. Aristides Agramonte, by Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, [August 6, 1950]
div1.p:
Documents belonging to Dr. Aristides Agramonte, loaned
to Dr. Philip S. Hench of Rochester, Minn, in the spring
of 1948 (see letter of April 15, 1948).

list.item: 1. Autograph record of yellow fever mosquito bites - 8 pages.

2. Carroll article - 5 pages and envelope with Dr. Guitera's
note.

3. Discurso del Dr. Agramonte, pronunciado en la ceremonia
del develamiento del busto de Finlay - 8 pages.

4. Article on “Beauperthuy, Finlay y la Comisión Americana”
-7 pages.

5. Agramonte speech, planned for the inauguration of Lazear's
tablet in Columbia University - 2 pages.
6. Two letters of Oct. 5, 1900, written from New York-3 pages
10. Agramonte to Adjutant General, Feb. 12, 1903 - 2 pages
13. Scott to Agramonte, Sept. 20, 1900 -1 page front and back.
14. Paymaster General to Agramonte, Jan. 13, 1903 - 3 pages. 2 p

15. Eleven letters Sternberg to Agramonte Apr. 19, 1898 to
Jan 26, 1900 - 12 pages.

16. Reed to Agramonte, May 2 1901; envelope and 2 folders
-7 pages.

17. Statement signed by Spanish volunteers, Nov. 22 1900
- 3 pages. folder 2 p

18. Agramonte to Sternberg, Dec. 24, 1899 (page and endorse_
ments) 2 pages.

19. Hemmeter to Agramonte - 3 letters and small note - 5
pages and note.

div1.p:
Please return by registered air mail, at the earliest
possible date.
